results.title: Cinnamon Streusel Muffins
results.summary: You can never have too many morn meal recipes, so give Cinnamon Streusel Muffins a try. One portion of this dish contains around 0g of protein, 0g of fat, and a total of 11 calories. For 1 cents per serving, this recipe covers 0% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 180. Head to the store and pick up apple pieces, cinnamon streusel muffin mix, golden raisins, and a few other things to make it today. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 15 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 11%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes include Cinnamon Streusel Muffins, Pumpkin Cinnamon Streusel Muffins, and Apple Cinnamon Streusel Muffins.

steps.step: Prepare muffin mix according to package directions, stirring dried apple pieces and golden raisins into batter.
Place foil baking cups in muffin pans. Spoon batter into cups, filling two-thirds full.
Bake and cool muffins according to package directions.
Note: For testing purposes only, we used Betty Crocker Cinnamon Streusel Premium Muffin
Mix.

results.title: Apple Fruit Baskets
results.summary: Apple Fruit Baskets might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.9 per serving. One serving contains 166 calories, 1g of protein, and 0g of fat. 45 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. A mixture of licorice, club soda, fruit, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 44%. This score is good. Try Cookie Fruit Baskets, Banana Baskets, and Chicken in Baskets for similar recipes.

steps.step: Start by cutting the top off of an apple. Use an apple corer or a metal spoon to scoop out the insides of the apple out leaving a quarter-inch intact around the outside. (You can dice the apple pieces that you scooped out and add them to the other diced fruit or use it for another purpose.)Carefully cut two notches into the sides of the apple, about the width of a piece of licorice, directly across from each other, without cutting the peel.
Place the apples in a bowl and fill them with club soda, allowing them to soak for about 3 minutes.
Pour out the club soda and insert the pieces of licorice into the cut-out notches.Fill the apple baskets with the diced fruit.Store in the fridge until ready to serve.

results.title: Instant Pot Applesauce
results.summary: Need a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish? Instant Pot Applesauce could be an outstanding recipe to try. This recipe serves 4 and costs 95 cents per serving. One serving contains 145 calories, 1g of protein, and 0g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. Head to the store and pick up to 8 apples, cinnamon, water, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 1%. This score is very bad (but still fixable). Try Instant Pot Chicken Pot Pie Soup, Instant Pot One-Pot Spaghetti with Meat Sauce, and Instant Pot Mashed Potatoes for similar recipes.

steps.step: Peel and cut apples into 2 inch chunks.

Place apples and all other ingredients into the Instant Pot.Close Instant Pot lid,ensuring the vent is in the sealed position. Press the "manual" button and adjust to high pressure and set the timer to 8 minutes. The Instant Pot will preheat before beginning the cooking time.Once the timer goes off, let sit for about 2-3 minutes. Turn steam vent to release pressure and carefully release the steam and remove lid.
Drain off any excess water.

Place cooked apples in a mixture and mix on low until desired applesauce consistency is reached - smooth or chunky! Allow to cool slightly before serving. NOTE: This recipe can also be used when canning or freezing applesauce!

results.title: Baked Apple Chips
results.summary: Baked Apple Chips might be just the dessert you are searching for. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 4 and costs 52 cents per serving. One serving contains 96 calories, 0g of protein, and 0g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. A mixture of ground cinnamon, brown sugar, ground cardamom, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 3 hours and 10 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 3%. This score is very bad (but still fixable). Try Oven Baked Apple Chips, On the Job: Big Apple Guacamole with Sweet & Savory Baked Tortilla Chips, and Crabmeat, Apple, and Mango Salad on Cumin Apple Chips for similar recipes.

steps.step: Use a mandoline slicer (this is the one I used) or knife to cut the apples into thin slices.
Remove the seeds.
Mix together brown sugar, ground cinnamon, and ground cardamom.
Put the apples on a parchment covered baking sheet.Sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar mixture.
Bake at 220F for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven, flip the apple slices over, and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar mixture again. Return the pans to the oven rotating the pan from the top rack to the bottom racks.
Bake at 220F for 1 hour and 30 minutes.

Remove a couple of baked apple chips and let them cool on a plate on the counter for a couple of minutes to see if they get crispy. If so, you are done. If not, continue baking until the apple chips feel dry to the touch and crisp up within a couple of minutes of cooling.Store in an airtight container for up to one week.

steps.step: Combine all ingredients in a large pitcher. Cover and chill 8 hours or until candies are dissolved.
Pour mixture into a large Dutch oven and cook over medium heat until thoroughly heated.

results.title: Caramel Fondue
results.summary: Caramel Fondue is a gluten free and vegetarian hor d'oeuvre. This recipe serves 18 and costs 73 cents per serving. One serving contains 313 calories, 6g of protein, and 7g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 24%. This score is not so super. Similar recipes are Caramel Fondue, Caramel Fondue, and Chocolate Caramel Fondue.

steps.step: Place caramels in a 3-quart slow cooker; stir in condensed milk.
Cover and cook on LOW 3 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally, until caramels melt and mixture is smooth.
Serve with apple slices and pound cake squares.
Party Plan: Keep this fondue warm in the slow cooker for easy dipping. Reheat any leftovers in the microwave, stirring at 1-minute intervals until heated through.

steps.step: Generously spread almond butter on one apple slice. Sprinkle granola over almond butter and top with another apple slice. Repeat using remaining apple slices and almond butter.

results.title: Glazed Apple and Sausage with Pancakes
results.summary: Glazed Apple and Sausage with Pancakes might be just the main course you are searching for. This dairy free recipe serves 4 and costs $1.33 per serving. To use up the flour you could follow this main course with the Apple Tart with Caramel Sauce as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. steps.step: Heat sausage according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a 1-1/2-qt. microwave-safe dish, combine flour and water.
Add apple and onion. Cover and microwave on high for 3 minutes.
Stir in brown sugar. Cover and cook on high for 1-2 minutes or until sugar is dissolved.
Cut sausage into bite-size pieces.
Add to apple mixture.
Serve with pancakes.

steps.step: Shake the tequila and juices with ice and strain into a martini glass. Dust apple slice generously with cayenne pepper.
Garnish and serve.

results.title: Cracklin'-Fresh Picnic Ham with Apple-Cranberry-Pomegranate Salsa
results.summary: The recipe Cracklin'-Fresh Picnic Ham with Apple-Cranberry-Pomegranate Salsa could satisfy your Mexican craving in around 14 hours and 20 minutes. For $2.08 per serving, you get a main course that serves 10. One serving contains 488 calories, 64g of protein, and 23g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. Head to the store and pick up one-sided razor blade, apple-cranberry-pomegranate salsa, skin-on pork picnic shoulder, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Try Apple-Cranberry-Pomegranate Salsa, Fresh Pomegranate Salsa for Christmas, and Apple and Pomegranate Salsa for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé are my top picks for Mexican. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. One wine you could try is Carneros Hills Winery Pinot Noir. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 28 dollars.

productMatches.title: Carneros Hills Winery Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: The Carneros Hills Winery Pinot Noir exhibits aromas of sandalwood, wisteria, cinnamon, and forest floor that weave through bright cherry and raspberry fruit notes. On the palate, red currant, allspice, bacon and wild fennel arise, while a focused core of acidity and broadening minerality expand into fine-textured, mouth-coating tannins.

steps.step: Make 1/4-inch-deep cuts 1/4 inch apart in skin of ham with a clean box cutter. (The sharp blades cut through the skin with ease and make straight edges.) Stir together salt and pepper; rub over ham, working into cuts in skin.
Place ham in a very large bowl, and cover with plastic wrap. Chill 2 days.
Remove ham from bowl.
Brush salt from ham, and discard.
Place ham, fat side up, on a wire rack in a jelly-roll pan, and chill, uncovered, 8 to 10 hours to air-dry.
Let ham stand at room temperature 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 42

Bake ham on lower oven rack 45 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 325, and bake 2 hours and 30 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 425, and bake 30 to 35 minutes or until skin is crisp and a meat thermometer inserted into thickest portion registers 17
Let stand 30 minutes before slicing.
Serve with salsa.
